intro: Silene colorata var. cyrenaica, commonly known as the Cyrenaica pink, is a flowering plant native to North Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
